page.title: 17BRISTOL REDLAND GREEN
page.content: Redland Green is a local park.One part is higher up by Redland Chapel,built in 1740 for the Cossins of Redland Court (now Redland High Scool).An avenue of trees leads to the chapel with a grass triangle which is the site of Redland Fair,held every May day bank holiday for the last 8 years. This year my mum organised the fair. There were 60 stalls,selling all kinds of things,with a Punch and Judy show a brass band and Maypole and Morris dancing. Further along is a bowling green and children's playground.Nearby is Bristol Lawn Tennis where the West of England Championships are held.A path leads down to the stream and a large grassy dip. This part used to be a farm.My neighbour who is 70 can remember shep grazing here.The old farmhouse is still there.
